title: Turning to drones and other instruments to hunt hurricanes
itunes:title: Turning to drones and other instruments to hunt hurricanes
itunes:author: Marketplace / Marketplace Tech Staff
description: Forecasters from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, NOAA, predict yet another season of “above-normal” hurricane activity. To track and predict these storms, scientists rely on data from satellites, radar and planes. This year, on top of that technology, staff at NOAA will also be using a fleet of autonomous vehicles in the air and at sea to reveal new data about what happens during the worst of a storm. Marketplace’s Kimberly Adams speaks with Jason Dunion, NOAA’s hurricane field program director.
